songs.full_title: Kill Jill by Big Boi (Ft. Jeezy, Killer Mike & Rock D the Legend)
songs.title: Kill Jill
songs.title_with_featured: Kill Jill (Ft. Jeezy, Killer Mike & Rock D the Legend)

description.plain:
This track was featured on Big Boi’s third solo album Boomiverse. It was released on 4/20, an unofficial weed holiday and guest rapper Killer Mike’s Birthday. “Kill Jill” was the second of three singles released from the album.

The title is a play on the 2003 Quentin Tarantino film Kill Bill and is a sexual brag track on Killer Mike’s part and a chance for Big Boi to announce his return, as well as touch on social issues such as Bill Cosby’s rape allegations.

songs.full_title: All Night by Big Boi
songs.title: All Night

description.plain: The Apple iPhone X helped transform this under the radar summer jam into a worldwide banger.  Big Boi kicks off “All Night” with a homage to monogamy and reliability in his relationship. In his younger days, Daddy Fat Sax fell to the seductions of both “skinny slim women” and “big girls”, but his marriage to Sherlita Fat Sax (nee, Patton) has shown him that respect and monogamy is more important than the passing pleasures of the Lothario.

songs.full_title: Royal Flush by Big Boi (Ft. André 3000 & Raekwon)
songs.title: Royal Flush

description.plain:
Samples the hook of the Isley Brothers' Voyage to Atlantis (the best song ever).

Sample appears at 1:33

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fh6lGI1bOkw#t=93

A follow up to “Skew it on the Bar-B”, the first time OutKast and Raekwon teamed up. Intended to be on Big Boi’s solo debut, this song was removed due to legal disputes. This song reunites Daddy Fat Sax and 3 Stacks, giving fans hope that OutKast might put out another album, but we are still waiting. Andre has the longest and best verse here.

songs.full_title: Objectum Sexuality by Big Boi (Ft. Phantogram)
songs.title: Objectum Sexuality

description.plain: The title “Objectum Sexuality” suggests that Big Boi may be lamenting the way women value him for his trapping of wealth and the objects he can give them – a frequent theme in his songs.  However, with the female vocalist’s final verse, we learn that the “object” is actually her:  It is she who is feeling objectified by Big Boi, and only valued by him for her looks and sexuality.

description.plain:
The second single from the forthcoming Boomiverse. 80’s funk swagger is in full play here, complimented with sweaty synths and the strong vocals of both Adam Levine and Big Boi. While the song was performed on The Tonight Show, Dungeon Family affiliate Sleepy Brown was subbed in as a stand-in for Levine.

Didn't say that Rico, Ray and Pat was getting with me and Three Stacks
Then we spitting 'cause we killing everything that we attack
Special Forces of the rap game, so you best take heed of that

Wack-ass nigga

Another battle won, another story to tell

Undefeated on the battle field
Against the means of ignorance, greed, and hatred
All contenders to the throne are left naked
Because the truth is the only thing you can never be stripped of
And if you want to commit to that truth
Then you could end the vicious cycle that's affecting our youth today
If you just stop lying, if you just stop lying
